title: 105_hr1476
content: The "Miccosukee Settlement Act of 1997" is cited as the short title. Congressional findings are outlined in the Act. The Miccosukee Settlement Act of 1997 acknowledges a lawsuit involving tribal lands taken for highway construction in Florida. The agreement between the Florida Department of Transportation and the Miccosukee Tribe requires Congress' consent to settle the dispute. The Miccosukee Settlement Act of 1997 requires Congress' consent for land transfers. The settlement benefits the Miccosukee Tribe with monetary payments, new reservation land held in trust by the United States, and other benefits. The United States will hold land in trust for the tribe as compensation for land lost to the Florida Department of Transportation. The Miccosukee Settlement Act of 1997 requires Congress' consent for land transfers and benefits the Miccosukee Tribe with monetary payments, new reservation land held in trust by the United States. Congress shares a desire to resolve the dispute and settle the lawsuit with the parties involved in the settlement agreement. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. The Miccosukee Tribe is defined as a recognized tribe of American Indians in Florida. Miccosukee land refers to land held in trust for the tribe. The Florida Department of Transportation is responsible for various matters including construction. The Florida Department of Transportation is responsible for the construction and maintenance of surface vehicle roads in Florida. The board of trustees of the Internal Improvements Trust Fund is the agency holding legal title to certain lands in the state. The State of Florida includes all state agencies and departments, such as the Florida Department of Transportation and the board of trustees. The curr_chunk provides definitions for key terms related to land transfers in a lawsuit involving the Miccosukee Tribe of Indians of Florida. The terms include "Secretary," "land transfers," "lawsuit," and "settlement agreement." The curr_chunk defines the terms "settlement agreement" and "agreement" as documents signed on August 28, 1996, by Ben G. Watts and Billy Cypress, concurred by the board of trustees of the Internal Improvements Trust Fund of Florida. The curr_chunk states the authority of the Secretary. The Secretary, as trustee for the Miccosukee Tribe, shall aid in fulfilling the settlement agreement, sign it on behalf of the United States if legally sufficient, and ensure conditions for land transfer are met. Upon meeting necessary conditions, the land transfer agreement will be fulfilled, transferring Miccosukee land to the Florida Department of Transportation and receiving Miccosukee Tribe ownership of land identified for transfer to the United States. Settlement agreement for transfer of Indian Reservation lands of the Miccosukee Tribe to the United States. Settlement agreement for transfer of Indian Reservation lands of the Miccosukee Tribe to the United States. Passed the House of Representatives on November 13, 1997. Attest: ROBIN H. CARLE, Clerk.
